text:
My name is Andre Lamego and
I'm the CTO of SAP Concur.

SAP Concur is an integrated
travel and expense solution.

So we had four main
objectives for our business.
We wanted to not have to worry
about those physical infrastructure.

We wanted to optimize our
resources to focus on innovation.
The third is we wanted to expand.

The fourth one is, of
course, our cost concern.
With all of those requirements combined,
we got the goal of migrating to AWS.
We use a variety of AWS services.

For example, we use EKS for
our container management.
We use Auto Scaling,
and we also use Amazon Bedrock
for our generative AI workloads.

With migration of 85,000
SQL Server databases,
licensing was obviously a concern.

We opted to use
Bring Your Own License (BYOL).
There is also an AWS program

called Optimization and Licensing
Assessment (OLA).

that helps realizing what
is the best opportunity

for cost reduction while
executing our database workloads.
The fact that we transition out
of our co-locations into AWS
allowed us to focus more on features.

Our customers benefit
from our transition to AWS
because all our efforts
are now towards serving the customer.

We will have a projection of
cost reduction of about 70%

from the point that we
started our migration efforts.
The fact that our integration environments
and our production environments
look the same and operate the same
allows us to more efficiently test

and deliver services and
features with confidence.
